qa.name: Sherlock Paws
qa.essence: Intelligent and witty talking dog detective
qa.appearance: Golden Retriever with a deerstalker hat
qa.clothing: Deerstalker hat and a small magnifying glass on a collar

json_to_edit.voice_over: In a city where humans couldn't crack the case, it took a four-legged genius to unravel the mystery.
json_to_edit.description: Sherlock Paws investigates a series of mysterious disappearances in the city park.
json_to_edit.ambience_sound_keywords: Birds chirping, distant traffic, rustling leaves
json_to_edit.name: Paw Prints and Clues
json_to_edit.scene_summary: Sherlock Paws, the talking dog detective, investigates mysterious disappearances in the city park.

qa.action: Wide view of the bustling city park on a sunny day.

hf.sfx_keywords: footsteps on gravel, dog tags jingling
hf.action: Sherlock Paws entering the park, his nose twitching as he picks up a scent.

tr.action: Sherlock's nose working overtime as he follows an invisible trail.

xc.action: Sherlock Paws interviewing a group of squirrels near a large oak tree.

ka.sfx_keywords: paws scratching on dirt, leaves rustling
ka.action: Sherlock digging near a bush, uncovering a hidden clue.

fn.action: A crumpled note with a cryptic message being held in Sherlock's mouth.

af.sfx_keywords: panting, paw steps on various surfaces
af.action: Following Sherlock as he races across the park, hot on the trail.

qo.action: Sherlock Paws dramatically pointing his paw at the culprit, surrounded by amazed onlookers.

fp.action: The park community gathering around Sherlock Paws, celebrating the solved mystery.

edit_command: Rearrange the order of shots to create a non-linear narrative. Move the 8th shot to be the 2nd, the 3rd shot to be the 7th, and the 6th shot to be the 4th. Don't change anything else in the scene.

label.rationale:
we will rearrange the order of shots as requested to create a non-linear narrative. this will involve updating the "list_display_order" in the "shots" object and ensuring that the corresponding shot descriptions remain unchanged. here's how we'll make the changes:

1. move the 8th shot (qo) to be the 2nd
2. move the 3rd shot (tr) to be the 7th
3. move the 6th shot (fn) to be the 4th

the new order will be: qa (1st), qo (2nd), hf (3rd), fn (4th), xc (5th), ka (6th), tr (7th), af (8th), fp (9th).

we'll update the "list_display_order" string accordingly while keeping all other information in the json unchanged. this rearrangement will create an interesting non-linear narrative, starting with the establishing shot, then jumping to the dramatic revelation of the culprit, before going back to show how sherlock paws arrived at this conclusion.
